title: 5 takeaways from the Revolution’s season-opening defeat in Nashville
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution lost 4-1 to Nashville SC in the 2026 MLS opener at Geodis Park.
Revolution's defense struggled with three of four starting defenders missing, leading to defensive breakdowns.
New coach Marko Mitrović faces a challenging debut, needing to address defensive weaknesses and lineup decisions.

title: New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station break down again
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station malfunction due to harsh winter conditions, closing twice since opening.
The gates, costing about $3.3 million, shut during storms due to wind and snow, impacting commuter access.
Despite closures, fare evasion efforts succeed with mTicket activations up 42% since gate implementation.

title: Watch: Jack Hughes delivers USA first Olympic gold medal in men’s hockey since 1980, team honors Johnny Gaudreau
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jack Hughes scored in overtime to give Team USA a 2-1 win over Canada, securing Olympic gold in ice hockey.
Team USA honored Johnny Gaudreau by including his children in the celebration after the gold medal victory.
Bruins' Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman returned with gold medals; they are the first active Bruins to do so since 2014.

title: After homering in spring training debut, could Andruw Monasterio play big role for Red Sox in 2026?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Andruw Monasterio hit a homer in the Red Sox' Grapefruit League opener against the Twins’ pitcher Justin Topa.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora praised Monasterio's athleticism and versatility, hinting at a key role in 2026.
Monasterio’s versatility enhances his chances of being the Red Sox’ primary platoon infielder in 2026.

title: MSP arrests Maine man after he allegedly crashed truck twice while on drugs
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Andrew Beaulieu, 30, from Carthage, Maine, was arrested after allegedly crashing his truck twice on drugs in Massachusetts.
Beaulieu was charged with possession of a class C drug, operating under influence, and negligent operation of a vehicle.
Police found synthetic cannabinoids in Beaulieu's truck; he was arraigned in Fall River District Court and pleaded not guilty.

title: Methuen woman searching for her wedding dress after dry cleaner mix-up
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Kathleen Shea Dunleavy discovered she had a different bride's wedding dress after a 15-year mix-up with a Methuen dry cleaner.
Dunleavy reunited the Salem, NH, bride with her gown but still seeks her own dress, mistakenly swapped in 2010.
Her missing gown, from Deluxe Cleaners, features buttons, a flower appliqué, and initials 'KS' embroidered in blue.

title: At Chevalier Theatre, Mavis Staples lives up to her legacy of joy and protest
author: Terence Cawley
bullets: Mavis Staples performed at Chevalier Theatre in Medford, blending gospel-soul roots with modern Americana influences.
At 86, Staples showcased her deep, recognizable voice, balancing joyous music with reminders of social issues.
The setlist included Staples Singers classics and covers, finishing with 'Everybody Needs Love' for an uplifting finale.

title: Here’s how the Red Sox plan on handling MLB’s new ABS challenging system
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Red Sox player Wilson Contreras successfully used the MLB's new ABS challenge system during spring training on February 21, 2026.
Manager Alex Cora supports utilizing the ABS system, encouraging players not to hesitate in challenging pitch calls.
MLB's ABS challenge rules allow two initial challenges per game, with unlimited successful challenges retaining their count.

title: Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet weighs in on Lucas Giolito’s ongoing free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Red Sox pitcher Lucas Giolito remains unsigned in free agency after opting out following a strong 2025 season.
Garrett Crochet, Red Sox ace, is surprised by Giolito's free agent status, highlighting his 3.41 ERA and 10-4 record in 2025.
Boston added pitchers Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez, reducing the likelihood of Giolito's return to the Red Sox.

title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Colts' Michael Pittman Jr., with a $24 million cap hit, could be a Patriots trade target to improve their receiving core.
Bears' DJ Moore, rumored for trade, could address receiver needs, but comes with a $24.5 million cap hit.
Seahawks' Uchenna Nwosu, an edge rusher with a $11.5 million cap hit, is a potential target for Patriots' defensive reinforcement.
